text:
After doling out cheaper data plans, Reliance Jio Infocomm Ltd. has moved its focus to premium users. The new telecom operator has offered a 70-percent buyback deal for those who will use iPhone 8 and iPhone 8 Plus on its network for a year.“This is the first time such a buyback offer is introduced in India,” said Akash Ambani, son of Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani, on the sidelines of the launch of iPhone 8 and iPhone8 Plus at the Reliance Corporate Park in Navi Mumbai.Customers can upgrade their iPhone 8 to iPhone 8 Plus or buy an iPhone X using the buyback scheme available across Reliance Digital and Jio stores, the Jio app or website, and Amazon.in, he said.Reliance Jio, which had the highest market share of 41 percent in the broadband services as of June 30, will also provide 400 channels through the JioTV app which will be available on iPhones equipped with the Jio network.The company has also launched a special tariff plan of Rs 799 a month for postpaid Jio users. This plan will provide 90 gigabytes of 4G data every month along with free voice, SMS and subscriptions to Jio apps. “Jio will make the desirable iPhone 8 available to millions of Indians,” said Mukesh Ambani.The company will also offer additional discounts for Citi credit and World debit card users.






(Corrects the number of channels Reliance Jio will provide through the JioTV app.)
title: Reliance Jio Offers 70% Buyback On iPhone 8 And iPhone 8 Plus
